item.title: Inductive Bias
item.description: References : Reading: Tom Mitchell Lectures slides of chapter 2 Tom Mitchell, Machine Learning Chapter 2 To Read: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inductive%5Fbias Questions : The inductive bias of a learning algorithm is the set of assumptions that the learner uses to predict outputs given inputs that it has not encountered. Consider a concept learning algorithm L for the set of instances X.
